document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

FA0CCF09A7464EBEA2324C69C26FF3E5.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations and read-alouds.

9EF16CEB10344E4C8D81355396273667.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and
listening at the college and career-readiness level.

501FC932386747DD88C896D4E60672EA.description:
Act out word meanings. Indicate increasing specificity of vocabulary (e.g., transitioning from calling
something an animal to calling it a dog or a cat).

3202500A8F6E46579D56B3778004064C.description:
Make and apply connections between words and their usage including synonyms and antonyms
(e.g., big park, small room).

BECAE08214C54F289AFF0EF4BAEA33A2.description:
Recognize, sort, and categorize words (e.g., colors, clothing) to show comprehension. Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims, a tiger is a large cat
with stripes).

02CCF39944D44DA39F93E523B80D115B.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and differences in word meanings.

44EDA7ED490D4CC4B41440323A326AB0.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

7517D5C9DC1A47C4A7BEDFD330FCC661.description: Use basic phonemic awareness strategies to decode words.

ED5C74AF98DD49F2AB5476001255F65E.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked,
looking).

E6D5589BC47A44889207DDA618A7430A.description: Add prefixes to words and determine new meaning (e.g., happy/unhappy, view/review).

6011428870054F6FB30B4981DCEDFAEF.description:
Use context clues and illustrations to identify the meaning of unfamiliar words including compound
words.

43524D187DF24E03AF63588C789905DC.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on class reading and
content area study, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

C109F6F88DD342138C995FAE74F12F31.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

81001FB2127A4C679ACC2B7195C289E0.description:
Choose words and phrases for different purposes (e.g., slang, written vs. spoken, formal vs.
informal).

DDB6A8DD87764F32A1FC7DD30BD99D9C.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

B28F382FD62441C9BEAC96B72E6D6C74.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

1CB11D42C022469A94B956755B4165B6.description:
Consult reference materials, including picture and standard dictionaries, as needed to check and
correct spelling.

0FFAF0C853DF4DBEBFEF71415835AEC6.description:
Use conventional spelling for basic sight words with common spelling patterns and for frequently
occurring irregular words (e.g., said = /s/ /e/ /d/).

69541B8A5B084BA99B50955491989E47.description: Write a letter or letters for short and long vowel sounds (phonemes).

3CD1FC30BF124831A4FD044EA69B5B57.description: Use a period for end punctuation of sentences.

D1A14DE85B814477B08904E641024921.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence, dates, and names of people.

94FB0DC5C18D46B7A47F1464C87C5955.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

968BB052BF124BBDA0F3483E4B1732B7.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

EC4FBA14E6D84729B43D5474799866CA.description: Produce and expand complete simple sentences.

DDD22D17D1264BE7821EEC64D7FBBFD2.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

0BEBF67629A74514907CA8030D33A18B.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., in, on, under, in front, behind, next to).

7852DF25266F4C20BCB99E1612A4F8AE.description:
Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home. / Today I
walk home. / Tomorrow I will walk home.).

68697DE1961F457C90047EC7713E9ED2.description:
Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring regular verbs (e.g., want/wanted,
play/played).

9377A7F05C2E45708D71144699B8E4E0.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

7386FDEFCCC046BE8DF79A31DB1538C2.description: Form singular and plural nouns that agree with verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops. / We hop.).

918F7B6507DB4AE69823FBA8564A2C7A.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

527E398E393748B991BBB31BC5CCDAE4.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing or speaking.

B4D0490C514D479091A9EC3FD3BA8AEF.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

3F726B4CC6D648DF89A02808717D4037.description:
With guidance and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, invented and creative writing, and/or labeling
a picture with a few words following a prompt.

821609632C4549A289C5A69C594C47C5.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

0E6A8497834F4138A66E87C47904F17E.description:
Use experiences to gather information from a variety of sources (e.g., word walls, book talks, weather charts,
routine tasks) to answer a question.

86893B5DB9C748E884D7A31C769C2CDD.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

83498BFB0E60403C8D312ACF3196A56D.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore several how-to books on a given
topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

B9C88B28CD03497F89E459D7514F893E.description: Participate in shared research to gather information about a topic (e.g., drawings, visual displays, labels).

4A62CAA5E0DD433495333BB86B80BF34.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

E6986372372C473C9E67BFB1167E8739.description:
Use a multimedia element to enhance a written task. Multimedia elements may include, but are not limited to,
drawings, pictures, artifacts, and audio or digital representations. At this grade level, the multimedia element should relate to the task.

ED294F10DF6C42E6887884FC289FCC33.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in
collaboration with peers.

0A5867BEFF744034A7D4F8ED5EE293E6.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

C5C6322B5211496A8BAD207DD987D720.description:
With guidance and support, brainstorm ideas, and use feedback on a topic (e.g., additional texts, drawings, visual displays,
labels) to strengthen writing.

B082D8E455744442B5CF4E62D25171BD.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and publishing).

82DE97147680452087174BF1B1DCA406.description: With guidance and support, express opinions about a topic or text with at least one supporting reason.

AD32186D4A1A4AA285DF739ADB852CB4.description: With increasing independence, use a combination of simple sentences (subject + verb), copying, and drawing to compose short literary texts collaboratively with a teacher or peers.

07D67E2F22BF4C7EB5BF148161209A06.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

C3CB54C49D3646FCB04AE17AC49A7504.description: With increasing independence, use a combination of simple sentences (subject + verb), copying, and drawing to compose short informational texts using high-frequency words collaboratively with a teacher or peers.

25E06DB89D6F42FDBB902808D4CD5413.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection, organization,
and analysis of relevant content.

F427EB4EBD034DECA5F6D48CB912B350.description: Write simple sentences (subject + verb) using high-frequency words and illustrations to express opinions and feelings or describe a picture, person, or object.

756CD8C0FEC94A12A3155894339FD079.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

18B28F461FAD4ED6AECA9DB11EFE7160.description:
Read literary texts (e.g., folktale, realistic fiction, animal fantasy, legends, fairytales, poetry) and informational (e.g.,
science or social science articles) with purpose and understanding.

B44FA866B7194CCABFD8E8F72FF58417.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

E851E23CCFAA4F5DA5D321ECACF9AFB9.description:
Describe basic similarities and differences between two informational texts on the same topic (e.g.,
illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

110E89367A8D4D4BB87D8DB9C5CFC235.description: Describe the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

180B5EBFBBAF4515A0C7BE7FD3E1986D.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

B1DFCC81E59443AEBE55A217E9978723.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

86A4573A35C84B88B96BE0335F46A45E.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

C377D2B141D54A08AA25AA779287C6E1.description: Use titles, headings, and illustrations to predict and confirm text topics.

53A9F5AAC9EB46C6AB784FD43CEE5ED8.description:
Use illustrations (picture cues) to identify or describe story details and categorize similarities and differences
between characters and details within a variety of grade level texts (e.g., nursery rhymes, folktales, etc.) or when viewing multimedia resources.

741C851F24F7431188BDFCC7DB7A9544.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

2125416E67644282A126E862B4F2F542.description: Distinguish information provided by illustrations (e.g., captions, charts, diagrams, graphs) in a text.

15C406473C404B9E9CB2D1888611E48B.description: Identify who is narrating the story: the author or the character.

1136CEDCAFF142AE93A0A48E409AC7B5.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

030A5CEBBD944224B106AC5C6B501792.description: Identify the differences between literary and informational texts.

42759D3B6DF54D6482E2632B1B045BE4.description:
Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, story organization [beginning, middle, and end], poems,
newspapers, magazines). Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

8BAF7E6E1EBC4F6987B25E3AA02F4250.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

24C16C4E1CCE43DB830D7DBA92ECAB78.description: Ask and answer questions or use illustrations to help determine or clarify the meaning of words in an informational text.

3055F09A27EE47DB89788FF4FB712E5D.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

406DEB416A214FDCA46D71A8CAEF2C21.description:
Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a literary text or use illustrations to help determine or
clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a literary text.

291E97D11F294CA49B3C58CE6BC4C242.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze how specific
word choices shape meaning or tone.

DED7588F02894690A3153E6CBE23C3B8.description:
With prompting and support, describe individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in an informational
text or from a read aloud.

A9B724EE034C4C34A71B9D4831BA0807.description:
With prompting and support, describe characters, settings, and major events in a story or from a read-aloud
using key details.

B3FBF18BFE0740D4BAB33CBBB3CD545C.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

7F1B727AB2CC41C6B3BC7B51D67CC3B7.description: Identify the main topic and key details of an informational text read aloud.

D60228D395124BCA9F56BD4651A99F8B.description: Identify the main idea and key details of a literary text at grade level.

58C9101F7D0B4A9F9FB0349BF03F9857.description: Retell familiar stories, including the main idea and key details at grade level.

D81AB61E04B9450D9C6F07D51C579500.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

DC37B59782BF4DCA97E5210D5E6B799C.description:
With prompting and support, make predictions, describe ideas, phenomena (e.g., how butterflies eat), textual elements (e.g., setting, characters), and key details based on understanding a variety of grade-level and read-aloud texts or multimedia
resources.

08CE893433594CD0B1E1B52A2E375260.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

D8AE9007DD6B479583E203409270E66C.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

062857DE3FA04547A4EB598651EF6035.description:
Read on-level texts orally with accuracy and appropriate rate and expression on successive
readings.

C1A904F16CE44B9A9981A089D49B063C.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

C590D36F88974C818F5BAF622CCA4BC1.description: With guidance and support, read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

F22F3B94A8214AFDAF9BB851F465C985.description:
Read common (50–100) high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do,
does).

5F90EF9ECA604A13BE32F4A1BF3688A9.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

FFEE90450DE3409C9E83B6693A75A5C1.description: Decode two- to three-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

9B656EE6B1364544AA3A2A70B6B3B845.description:
Determine the number of syllables in a printed word using the knowledge that every syllable must
have a vowel sound.

A017BDF735684AB9B3EEB3D9D216D5C8.description: Understand final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

FBB33B17D687499AA636D7505DBA7942.description: Understand the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.

C0098A49EA9A4E8C8554BBA4E92E46A2.description:
Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode short and long sound patterns and
their variants both in isolation and in text.

2413D300B1B54A4BA45BC640A160DF9D.description:
Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

76DC1C0E59B34932A451415674C6A895.description:
Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) with 3 phonemes in simple monosyllabic words to
make new words.

B44486103F724E49A1DA4008605AF598.description:
Blend 2 and 3 phonemes to recognize words. Segment onsets and rimes (e.g., all, ap, op, ip, ug) of
monosyllabic spoken words.

4164581C49264B77BC530AC82D320E22.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (3 to 5 phonemes) in spoken
monosyllabic (consonant-vowel-consonant or CVC, and variants) words.

7F909B4978C142CEAD3ED82D0B0A93C3.description:
Count and orally produce monosyllabic words by blending sounds (phonemes), including
consonant blends.

51AA1CA194784B9B9F1B8003296638E0.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

6FC632E0DB6D4C66BEBF0446810BADEB.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as singing,
chanting, or participating in finger plays.

AAF5EA9E287645F59625B0BDDB65A94B.description: Recognize and match rhyming words, including nonsense words.

E28D33FE623149F2B8252BFC29F3CDA6.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

FECD0E7C313A492EAC505BD7498730C0.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

5BD634FB709748129C75EFEAF4439500.description:
Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending
punctuation).

AA94CDD1B2B44662B3CAB691F09C70A9.description: Recognize that print conveys specific meaning and that pictures may support meaning.

69557AF9A5C2478EBEDB45B076C2C56E.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

6043FD7FF1234D42A8B4578AF75BFC83.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

3932FB6DA06A45C9A1FAE85DF894032E.description: Recognize that the alphabet consists of consonants and vowels.

23546C33FF9044C5BEFCBF84C8B28A5B.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

E368D4AE41D94172986C642CBF8283AE.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

A4A8F0DE0DF14E9A861EC8BE51E6B7A3.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

303FBE6D2ED64EA0B6632E4877C6A1E7.description: Recite, memorize, or present rhymes, poems, or songs.

B3D8F1C1EA754EA5A114795CDE57A6FD.description:
Retell literary (familiar stories) or informational texts using newly acquired vocabulary and details
appropriate to the situation.

283486EC44CE4F0B9D54498AD9226461.description:
Plan and deliver brief oral presentations on a variety of familiar topics using illustrations, objects, words, phrases,
or vocabulary from a text (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

14C78EDF63934A73BCE7AC32D677D626.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

7BA4E9C821E2451CB8FDBA6F6757A094.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings
clearly.

BA86C7A5431B4781BE082E473B22E758.description: Describe personal experiences using new vocabulary and details about familiar topics appropriate to the situation.

D349807363414AC7BB52598BF670CC0D.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

3C5B75BCF74A436797D3EC69A89D584C.description: Share and elaborate on statements, opinions, or arguments using language models or sentence starters (prompts).

834D25B77006485CA9F469ADB83082B1.description: With guidance and support, express opinions using an expanded set of learned phrases and recalling textual evidence or relevant background knowledge.

65FFDCBC1FD347AEBD82B20C13A0A732.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

05BE7A541AD14027905B231FC10FCF62.description:
Respond orally to conversations, read-alouds, texts, and oral presentations using a growing number of general, academic, and content-specific words and relying less on physical actions or other means of nonverbal
communication.

FC2CB2F4756E4EC19C8491BE2A6AFD12.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

BE53EAF9F7FF43CC96F2E9AD26E0BF43.description:
Expand sentences to provide details (e.g., Who? What? When?) about a familiar or new activity or
process.

C8D750CD8ECD419A85D353664F594979.description:
Use words, phrases, and short sentences to express ideas for a variety of purposes (e.g., to
communicate needs and desires, express feelings).

45F7994E7BE54EE689D24E317F9D2704.description: Exchange common social greetings, retell texts, and recount experiences using complete sentences.

63985F2CBFA74BBE9616EB6EC053AB15.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

3F0784C735174D4CBD51A765D5603C9B.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

8B5996D7A7BA4FFAA8620A4BCC6F9B2B.description: Participate in class, group, and partner discussions by listening attentively, following turn-taking rules, and asking and answering questions about stories and personal experience with increasingly elaborated responses, transitioning from one- or two-word responses to phrases and simple sentences.

BE7523B7CBAA451398C5C0E14C37A345.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

D1ECA5BF07F14C25BD179A789C8D33E2.description: Listen and respond to simple 5W and 1H questions.

5CC00D3099654CC68BDA4B0C3B222AC3.description:
Recognize and respond to greetings/farewells and courtesy expressions in routine and familiar
settings.

93B4C914890342D4BB57FE9B865DBCD5.description:
Repeat and respond to chants, poems, songs, and rhymes using phrases, physical movements,
etc.

97C19ED7BA2042E6B4E26651C8AAABA0.description: Listen and respond to simple commands and instructions or directions with 3 or more steps.

216CA2096D9640998BAA9AE713872872.description:
Use gestures and expressions to demonstrate engagement and understanding in a socially
appropriate manner.

BC8D00B45BFC4A31ACFA2F296EE09EA2.description:
Ask and answer questions appropriate to the topic and offer basic opinions in conversations using
learned phrases and open responses (e.g., I like . . . ).

F2EFB9A123384208AFD15147BBF13FA6.description: Listen to and interact with peers during social interactions; read‐alouds; and class, group, and partner discussions.

BAE15350639146F3B54D3D3974DEB03C.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
